Triggering Event: A slow afternoon at the clothing boutique where she'd worked for years. The store was eerily quiet, save for the occasional rustle of fabric. She had just finished folding a stack of sweaters when she noticed it: a small, handwritten note tucked into the sleeve of one. It read, "I'm sorry I couldn't afford to buy this for you." Her heart sank as she recognized his messy scrawl. Another reminder of her failed relationship and the life she'd hoped to build with him. She felt the familiar sting of tears welling up in her eyes, but quickly blinked them away, taking a deep breath before continuing her work, alone.
Generated Assessment: She couldn't help but feel a pang of disappointment every time he came by. His awkward attempts at conversation always left her feeling like she was stuck in an endless loop of disappointment. He seemed so distant, so disconnected from everything around him. Every little thing about him made her want to pull back and shut herself off. Even the way he looked at her made her feel like she was drowning in sadness. Every day felt like another step forward towards losing him. Every moment we spent together felt like a waste. He didn't even try to make things better - he just kept pushing me further down. And now, standing here in front of these clothes he'd bought for me, I can't shake the feeling that I'll never be happy again.

Triggering Event: A late-night knock at his apartment door reveals a young woman, tear-stained cheeks and arms wrapped around her stomach.
